Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; GROUND; PAINTED
Name: Jar stand
Description: Asymmetrical jar stand of which the lower lip ends in a triangular bead and the upper one is simply tapered and flared. A white slip decorates both lips, inside and outside. This jar stand was placed in a burial, at the feet of the deceased, and supported two cups.
